title: Penn State hires Cyclones' Campbell as new coach
content: Penn State named Iowa State coach Matt Campbell as the school's head football coach, the school announced Friday.

title: 'No heart': Ex-star Cousins rips UK after ugly loss
content: Former Kentucky star DeMarcus Cousins didn't hold back on his opinion on the Wildcats after their 35-point loss to No. 11 Gonzaga on Friday night, saying the team "has no heart."

title: On Wilt's heels, Durant 8th ever to hit 31K points
content: Rockets star Kevin Durant, who entered Friday as the NBA's No. 8 all-time leading scorer, reached the 31,000-point milestone in the first quarter against the Suns.

title: Poch: USMNT can't be complacent after WC draw
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said his objective over the next six months is to continue to improve the squad and "show full respect" for its World Cup group stage opponents.

title: Cool it! JMU AD scolds fans for throwing snowballs
content: James Madison athletic director Matt Roan used the public-address microphone to implore Dukes fans to stop throwing snowballs onto the field during the Sun Belt Conference championship game.

title: Schottenheimer: Will talk to Pickens about post
content: Cowboys coach Brian Schottenheimer said he will have a conversation with George Pickens about the wide receiver's social media post, which he has since deleted, in response to criticism he received from former All-Pro cornerback Richard Sherman.

title: Kansas star Peterson on track to play vs. Mizzou
content: Darryn Peterson, ESPN's projected No. 1 pick in the 2026 NBA draft, "should" be available for Kansas' matchup against rival Missouri on Sunday in Kansas City, coach Bill Self said Friday.

title: Someone had to 'challenge NASCAR,' Jordan says
content: Retired NBA great Michael Jordan testified Friday at the NASCAR antitrust trial that "someone had to step forward and challenge the entity" over its current business model.

title: ↔️ Olney and Passan: MLB free agency intel
content: Here's our latest intel heading into the MLB winter meetings, starting with the slugger who holds the key to the offseason.

title: CFP chaos scenarios for every league and what to watch in nine conference titles
content: Bill Connelly looks at key angles for all nine games -- and why the playoff committee could get a headache.

title: 2026 men's World Cup predictions: Group by group takeaways, must-see games
content: The draw is complete for the 2026 World Cup! What are the top matches to watch, and how will it all go down? We asked ESPN's writers to break down each group, highlight the storylines and make their predictions.

title: 10 NFL veterans who could unexpectedly be on the move this offseason: Surprise cut, trade candidates
content: Would the Eagles trade A.J. Brown in the offseason? Could the Ravens face salary cap decisions on two stars? Is Kyler Murray's time in Arizona running out?

title: Our guide to every Week 14 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions, picks and nuggets
content: Shedeur Sanders vs. Cam Ward? Joe Burrow vs. Josh Allen? Picks, predictions and stats for every Week 14 game.

title: Barnwell's end of the year prove-it list: 17 coaches and players with something at stake
content: Kenneth Walker III is among those with a lot to gain -- or lose -- over the season's final five weeks.

title: The old, struggling Clippers have options -- none of them good
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst surveyed the league on LA's next steps. Three difficult paths emerged.

title: This East lead hasn't come easy for the Pistons' young core
content: With every win, Detroit and its young core are moving further away from the dregs of a grueling rebuild.

title: Myles Garrett's journey to the NFL sack record: 'It is written'
content: Four sacks shy of making NFL history, the Cleveland Browns veteran is among the all-time great pass rushers.

title: Indiana freshman defies death, makes NCAA volleyball tournament
content: Toxic shock syndrome nearly killed Charlotte Vinson. Now she's hoping to help Indiana advance at the NCAA tournament.

title: Why are so many NHL games going to overtime? Five theories from players, coaches, execs
content: Through 425 games, 27.3% have gone past regulation. If that holds, it would be the highest rate since 2005-06.

title: Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, each team's most intriguing December game
content: The Capitals, Penguins and Flyers are the big risers this week, with the Ducks, Devils and Mammoth sliding.

title: MLS Cup in Miami is all about Messi. Can Müller, Vancouver crash the party?
content: It's fitting that MLS Cup takes place on the same weekend as Miami's art fair, as old masters Lionel Messi and Thomas Müller prepare to face off.

title: Why team-provided housing has become a flashpoint
content: As both sides continue negotiations ahead of the Jan. 9 deadline, housing emerged as an issue in the latest proposal.

title: The 30 best MMA fighters under 30 in 2025
content: From top stars Ilia Topuria and Dakota Ditcheva to rising contenders Joshua Van and Natalia Silva, ESPN ranks the top 30 fighters under age 30.

title: Power Rankings: Michigan leaps to No. 1, plus 5 new faces
content: The Wolverines had perhaps the best Feast Week to take them over Arizona and Purdue in a roller-coaster No. 1 race.

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 14: Trevor Lawrence and other QB replacements
content: If bye weeks or injuries have you seeking lineup help, consider the Jaguars' passing game and Titans defense.

title: Risers and fallers: Add Jaylon Tyson, trade away LeBron James, LaMelo Ball
content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upwards or downwards, with key takeaways for each.

title: Laurens' weekend preview: Can Real Betis halt Barcelona run?
content: It's Friday and a full weekend of action awaits across the soccer calendar as Julien Laurens picks out the best games ahead in Europe.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Man United eye Mouzakitis
content: Real Madrid could rival Manchester United to sign Olympiacos wonderkid Christos Mouzakitis. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: F1 title contenders: How they got here and who's bound for glory in Abu Dhabi
content: For the first time since 2010, more than two drivers have a shot at the title in the season finale, so how did the championship protagonists get here?

title: Debutant faces veterans in Ponnurunni East poll battle
content: LDF candidate Beena Divakaran, though a newcomer, is confident of the dominance of the front in the division where it has not tasted defeat in over four decades; three-time councillor Sunitha Dixon, BJP candidate, and UDF’s Jain Gray are her opponents

title: Manipur’s banned outfits warned against disrupting peace
content: A coalition of five armed groups threatened people who attended the recently concluded Sangai Festival with punitive action

title: Ernakulam reports highest number of influenza infections in Kerala
content: A total of 340 cases and two deaths, one each in Thiruvananthapuram and Malappuram, were reported in November

title: Path paved to link India’s skill base with Russia’s demand for labourers
content: Moscow is reported to need 5,00,000 semi-skilled workers; a formal agreement aims to facilitate safe mobility

title: GHMC reviews air quality measures in city NCAP meeting
content: Key measures include expanding TGSRTC electric bus fleet on high-pollution routes, promoting electric three-wheelers, tightening pollution-under-control compliance for older vehicles, improving pedestrian infrastructure

title: India-Russia friendship remains steady like the pole star, says PM
content: The Russian President is on a two-day visit; PM signals that energy ties will continue as a “strong and vital pillar” of the partnership, despite Western opposition; 16 MoUs signed; PM announces free e-tourist visas for Russians

title: Adani coal mine: Madhya Pradesh Congress MLAs protest felling of nearly 6 lakh trees in Singrauli
content: Minister of State for Forest Dilip Ahirwar says trees are being cut as per rules of the Centre and State, and that the same number of trees are being planted at different locations

title: As NC marks 120th birth anniversary of Sheikh Abdullah, no statement from J&K  Lieutenant Governor
content: Sheikh Abdullah founded the National Conference and was a former CM of J&K; L-G’s office usually issues statements on anniversaries of major public figures; scrapped move to declare holiday on anniversary

title: France’s Knight of the Order of Arts and Letters award to Ravi Deecee
content: The Ambassador of France to India confers the insignia of the award on the publisher and managing director of DC Books

title: DMK, BJP members face off in Lok Sabha over Karthigai Deepam ritual at  Thirupparankundram temple
content: DMK leader T.R. Baalu accuses the BJP of trying to “ignite communal tensions” in Tamil Nadu, while Union Minister of State for Parliamentary Affairs L.  Murugan  alleges that the State government is denying devotees their right to worship

title: High cost of infertility treatments puts financial strain on couples: ICMR-NIRRCH study
content: Stating that median out-of-pocket expenditure for infertility treatment was ₹11,317, the study said direct medical costs for medicines and investigations were high in private facilities while the non-medical and indirect costs were higher among those seeking infertility services from public facilities.

title: Women Safety Wing signs two MoUs to expand youth-led safety initiatives
content: Two partnerships aimed at strengthening community safety, youth leadership and gender-sensitisation programmes across the State

title: Calls grow for platform screen doors in metro stations, but rollout on existing routes faces cost and engineering setbacks
content: In February 2024, BMRCL installed metal railings along parts of the interchange platforms to limit track access. The corporation has since been studying the effectiveness of these installations, especially at high-traffic stations

title: Madras High Court restrains release of Nandamuri Balakrishna starrer Akhanda 2
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and C. Kumarappan grant the interim injunction following a monetary dispute between the production firm 14 Reels Plus LLP and Eros International

title: Kharge, Rahul not invited to Putin banquet: Congress
content: Shashi Tharoor makes it to the guest list as chairman of the Parliamentary Committee on External Affairs

title: Centenarian doctor donates ₹3.4 crore to AIIMS Bhubaneswar for cancer research
content: Professor K. Laxmi Bai’s contribution will create a corpus fund to support gynaecological oncology research and preventive care

title: Ruling regime trying to distort Nehru’s legacy: Sonia Gandhi
content: Speaking at the launch of the Nehru Centre India, the Congress leader says a ‘systematic effort’ was underway to distort Nehru’s ideas and undermine his contribution to the freedom movement and the shaping of modern India

title: Russia ships fuel for Kudankulam’s third reactor
content: The shipments of fuel are provided under the contract signed in 2024, which includes fuel supply for units 3 and 4 of the KKNPP for the entire service life starting from the initial loading

title: Weight loss drugs have great action, but can’t replace diet and exercise: Diabetes Federation president
content: “The new GLP-1 class of drugs comprises brilliant molecules that have very good action, but they are also very expensive”

title: New Bill will give employee right to ‘disconnect’ calls from work
content: Congress MP Manickam Tagore introduced a bill to exempt Tamil Nadu from the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test for admission to undergraduate medical courses

title: Indian Railways adds extra coaches to meet rush of weary passengers
content: After IndiGo flight cancellations, many passengers head to railway stations to catch trains to their destinations

title: Row in Lok Sabha after Trinamool MP objects to deportation of Bangla-speaking people
content: Shatabdi Roy’s remarks on language-based deportation spark protests as BJP MPs deny the charge and demand withdrawal of her comments

title: BJP alleges corruption in Corporation, CPI(M) leaders to take legal action
content: BJP alleges graft in selection of service provider for biocompost kitchen bin project and in tendering of civil works. V.K. Prasanth says a Vigilance inquiry has rejected all the allegations and roadwork rates are fixed as per CPWD rates

title: Lok Sabha passes Bill to levya special cess on pan masala
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman says the cess will be shared with the States; it will be levied on the production capacity of machines in pan masala manufacturing factories; main aim to meet expenditure on national security and health

title: Sunali returns to India six months after being pushed back into Bangladesh
content: On December 3, the Union government had agreed to bring Sunali Khatun and her minor son back from Bangladesh on ‘humanitarian grounds’ after the Supreme Court’s intervention.

title: 7-year-old girl dies of severe dengue shock syndrome in Bengaluru
content: The child’s parents, migrant workers, moved to the city two months ago and were living in shanty in Varthur

title: Minister unveils ₹97.40 lakh facilities at Nuzvid schools
content: Kolusu highlights youth role in nation-building, announces Student-Friendly Kits and notes recruitment of 16,347 teachers during Mega Parents-Teachers 3.0 programme

title: Party chiefs outline development, welfare projects for Kozhikode
content: A pre-poll discussion organised by the Calicut Press Club saw three district chiefs of mainstream political parties outlining their visions, priorities, expectations, and manifesto commitments ahead of the three-tier local body elections 2025

title: Rahul Mamkootathil’s staff member, driver named accused
content: Fazal and Alwin allegedly helped the legislator, who has been accused in a sexual abuse case, go absconding

title: Deadline approaches for Telangana’s Waqf Portal registrations amid uncertainties
content: Over 40,000 waqf institutions registered on the UMEED portal as of Friday; Telangana State Waqf Board ready to approach Waqf Tribunal to seek extension of deadline

title: Railway tracks blocked in Punjab as farmers push back against Electricity Amendment Bill, 2025
content: Farmers under the banner Kisan Mazdoor Morcha staged a ‘symbolic rail roko’ agitation and accused the Centre of ignoring their grievances. They also threatened to elevate the issue by removing the smart meters on December 10 if the demands remain unmet

title: Rajasthan begins Ferozepur Feeder reconstruction to strengthen canal irrigation network
content: Bhajan Lal Sharma launches ₹1,717-crore works to enhance irrigation in northern Rajasthan and improve water supply through the Gang Canal system

title: As IndiGo crisis continues, airlines take advantage charging high fare
content: The airfares to Kerala from various cities, including Delhi and Mumbai, are jacked up tenfold, leaving hundreds of passengers stranded in various cities

title: India, Russia agree on Arctic and nuclear cooperation
content: With polar ice melting, new sea routes may open in the Arctic; India, Russia welcome progress made in cooperation on the Northern Sea Route; India will “strive to” allot a site for a second nuclear plant after Kudankulam

title: Pawan Kalyan urges teachers to nurture achievers, not ‘manufacture employees’
content: Deputy Chief Minister stresses coordination among students, parents, and teachers; promises books, playground plan and warns against politicisation and substance abuse

title: YSRCP leader Karunakar Reddy cries foul over CID, ACB probe into Parakamani theft case
content: The investigation has not been done as directed by the court, the former TTD chairman alleges, and vows to quit politics if his alleged links with the main accused is proven

title: Telangana Rising 2047 Vision document getting final touches
content: Encompassing sector-specific plans to pave the way towards $3 trillion economy goal of Telangana; the document, in English, Telugu and Urdu, will be presented to 1,000 delegates

title: A.P. liquor scam: remand of nine accused extended till Dec. 19
content: Producing a key accused, Anil Chokhara, in the court, SIT sleuths claimed that he was instrumental in diverting the liquor scam proceeds through 35 shell companies

title: How Vizag woman’s death brought to light biggest organ-trafficking network in Andhra Pradesh
content: The 29-year-old woman left home saying she was going on a trip with friends, but it turned out to be her tragic end. The death of the woman from a below poverty line family exposed how vulnerable individuals and families fall prey to illegal organ sale networks. K. Umashanker and Harish Gilai delve deep into the racket allegedly operating from Global Multi-Specialty Hospital in Madanapalle

title: TDP leader condemns Jagan’s comments on ghee adulteration and Parakamani theft cases
content: How can the cases appear to be inconsequential for the YSRCP president, questions TDP official spokesman Vijay Kumar

title: Congress slams Modi government as IndiGo cancellations spark nationwide disruption
content: Rahul Gandhi links IndiGo crisis to the Centre’s monopoly model while the Congress accuses the government of weakening competition in India’s aviation sector

title: Kerala Governor, Chief Minister lock horns over selection of Vice-Chancellors
content: Pinarayi accuses Arlekar of violating SC directive regarding the appointment of Vice-Chancellors to KTU and digital university by picking a candidate the CM had found ineligible. Lok Bhavan says SC had clearly said that the Chancellor was free to have his reservations about the candidates recommended by the CM

title: Campaign against ‘privatisation’ of medical colleges receives overwhelming response, says YSRCP leader Sajjala Ramakrishna Reddy
content: Over one crore signatures have been collected in one week and the numbers are growing rapidly, he claims, adding the people’s movement has transformed into a massive pubic uprising

title: 'Taking strict action': Centre ramps up response amid IndiGo meltdown — what we know so far
content: Union civil aviation minister Ram Mohan Naidu has vowed strict action against those responsible for IndiGo's massive flight disruptions, caused by pilot-rostering issues. A committee is investigating the problem, while the DGCA has granted exemptions to help restore normalcy. IndiGo has apologized and offered waivers to affected passengers as operations slowly improve.

title: Putin promises non-stop energy, PM says Russia ties like pole star
content: India and Russia reaffirmed their strong ties, signing over a dozen agreements to boost economic partnership to $100 billion by 2030. Both nations committed to uninterrupted fuel shipments and discussed civil nuclear cooperation. Discussions also covered defense, manpower mobility, and India's UN Security Council bid, with leaders expressing satisfaction with the summit's outcomes.

title: ‘Babri’ event row: Calcutta HC orders Bengal govt to pull out all stops; beef up security
content: Calcutta High Court has ordered the Bengal government to prevent communal unrest in Murshidabad's Beldanga ahead of a suspended TMC MLA's controversial "Babri Masjid" foundation-laying ceremony on December 6.  Authorities have deployed significant security forces to maintain law and order, with the MLA proceeding with arrangements despite the court's directive.

title: Airport chaos: India’s World Cup winner stranded for 12 hours; slams IndiGo
content: IndiGo faces widespread passenger anger and flight disruptions due to new pilot rest regulations. Thousands were stranded, including cricketer Madan Lal, as over 1,000 flights were cancelled. The airline admitted to planning gaps and expects full normalisation between December 10 and 15.

title: Bengal: Suspended TMC MLA to lay 'Babri Masjid' foundation stone in Murshidabad;
content: Murshidabad braces for a tense Saturday as suspended TMC MLA Humayun Kabir plans to inaugurate a structure named "Babri Masjid."  Authorities have deployed over 3,500 security personnel following a Calcutta High Court directive to prevent communal unrest. Kabir insists the event will be peaceful, focusing solely on religious recitation, while the TMC denies involvement, alleging a political conspiracy.

title: ‘Metaverse’ budget cut: Zuckerberg plans slash resources; company loses $70 billion
content: Meta is reportedly slashing its Metaverse budget by up to 30% for 2026, signaling a potential shift away from its ambitious virtual reality vision after incurring over $70 billion in losses. This move comes as the company doubles down on artificial intelligence, investing heavily in AI infrastructure and talent acquisition.

title: FIFA World Cup 2026 draw: Argentina begin title defence vs Algeria
content: Lionel Messi and Argentina will open their title defense against Algeria, with further group-stage fixtures against Austria and tournament debutants Jordan in Group J. Spain, among the leading contenders and current European champions, will begin their campaign against first-time qualifiers Cape Verde before facing Uruguay and Saudi Arabia in Group H.

title: ‘Treated worse than animals’: 12 labourers from UP reportedly stranded in Kyrgyzstan
content: Twelve labourers from Pilibhit are reportedly stranded and facing severe harassment in Kyrgyzstan.  Families allege they were sent by local agents on misleading contracts, paid hefty sums, and are now subjected to brutal treatment and denied return.  The district administration has submitted a detailed report to the UP Home Department, initiating steps for their safe repatriation.

title: Feud over cow dung ends in murder: DU student stabbed to death in family brawl; 2 arrested
content: A Delhi University student was tragically stabbed to death in Sangam Vihar after intervening in a dispute between his mother and aunt over household waste. The 27-year-old LLB student's attempt to de-escalate the argument reportedly led to a violent confrontation with relatives, resulting in his fatal injury. Police have apprehended two individuals and are searching for others involved.

title: Ind vs SA: Pichai on Gemini’s creative power; ‘Nano Banana Pro’ prompt for AI miniature stadiums
content: India faces a series decider against South Africa today in Visakhapatnam.  Google CEO Sundar Pichai has sparked a viral trend by sharing AI-generated miniature stadium visuals.  Fans can now use a detailed prompt to create their own AI-powered visualizations of the crucial IND vs SA match, bringing the game to life with unique digital art.

title: Pan masala cess gets Lok Sabha nod in boost to defence priorities
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated the government aims to prevent UPA-era defence shortages by ensuring a steady revenue stream for modern warfare capabilities. A new cess on pan masala manufacturing units will fund national security and public health, addressing concerns about potential price drops and health impacts.

title: Ring missing? Mandhana's first post since wedding postponement - Watch
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana broke her social media silence with a toothpaste ad post, sparking speculation due to her missing engagement ring. Her wedding to Palash Muchhal was indefinitely postponed due to family medical emergencies, with recent nazar emojis in bios addressing further rumours.  Mandhana is set to return to cricket soon.

title: FDTL norms on hold: Govt steps in to fix IndiGo chaos; normalcy eyed by Dec 15
content: The government has temporarily suspended new pilot duty time rules to ease IndiGo's widespread flight cancellations, aiming for normalcy by December 15. This decision, made in the interest of passengers, follows significant disruptions and a substantial market value loss for IndiGo. Pilots' associations, however, criticize the move, citing safety concerns and questioning the airline's preparation.

title: Jeff Bezos' ex-wife’s donations: Scott cuts Amazon stake; gives millions to DEI causes
content: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief causes. Despite these large donations, Scott remains a prominent philanthropist.

title: 'He will decide India’s fate': Ex-India star picks X-factor for T20 World Cup
content: Irfan Pathan explains Rinku Singh's T20I squad exclusion, citing Hardik Pandya's return as the primary reason.  Pathan believes this squad is largely set for the 2026 T20 World Cup, emphasizing Hardik Pandya's pivotal role in India's global campaign and the need for clarity in pace and spin combinations.

title: Michael Annett dies at 39: Cause of former NASCAR star’s death and family reaction
content: Former NASCAR driver Michael Annett has passed away at 39, his former team JR Motorsports announced. Annett, a respected figure, achieved a significant victory at Daytona in the 2019 Xfinity Series. His career, marked by perseverance and skill, saw him race for various teams since 2008. The cause of his death remains undisclosed, leaving the motorsport community in mourning.

title: Russia makes first delivery of Nuclear-fuel for TN nuclear plant's 3rd unit
content: Undeterred by global pressures, Russia has commenced nuclear fuel deliveries for Kudankulam's third unit, reinforcing its commitment to uninterrupted energy cooperation with India. This marks the first VVER-1000 fuel shipment under a new contract, promising extended operational cycles and improved performance for India's growing nuclear power capacity.

title: Candace Owens slammed for ‘running scared’ from Charlie Kirk livestream
content: Candace Owens is facing criticism for contradicting herself. She publicly offered to debate Turning Point USA (TPUSA) leadership anytime, anywhere. However, when TPUSA scheduled a livestream to address her claims, Owens pushed back on the logistics. Critics accuse her of creating drama rather than accepting the challenge she initiated. The situation has become a test of consistency for the commentator.

title: Aryna Sabalenka & Georgios Frangulis net worth: Earnings, endorsements, business
content: Tennis star Aryna Sabalenka and her boyfriend, Oakberry founder Georgios Frangulis, are a financially successful couple. Sabalenka boasts a net worth in the high teens of millions from her WTA career and endorsements, while Frangulis's stake in his rapidly expanding açaí company places him in the multi-million-dollar range. Their combined wealth is estimated to be in the tens of millions.

title: NBA trade rumors: Warriors may re-sign $190M guard to help Stephen Curry
content: Golden State Warriors are reportedly considering a reunion with former star Klay Thompson, now with the Dallas Mavericks. Amidst organizational shifts in Dallas and the Warriors' ongoing search for consistent three-point shooting, a trade for Thompson is being discussed. His return could bolster Golden State's offense and recapture championship magic.

title: Complaint filed against Aryan for flashing middle finger
content: A complaint has been filed against Aryan Khan, son of Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan, for allegedly flashing the middle finger toward the crowd during a public event held at a Bengaluru pub on November 28. The incident, captured in viral videos, sparked online outrage and prompted legal action.

title: ‘Dhurandhar’ Day 1 Box Office: Ranveer’s film is 2025’s second-highest opener
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has shattered box office records, becoming this year's second-highest opener with ₹27 crore net on its first day. The film outperformed 'Saiyaara' and marks Ranveer Singh's highest opener ever, surpassing previous hits like 'Padmaavat' and 'Simmba'. Inspired by true events, the ensemble cast has been praised, though the runtime drew some criticism.

title: ‘Exclusive rights over temple rituals’, TN defends defying HC order in SC
content: Tamil Nadu's DMK government sought an urgent Supreme Court hearing on its appeal against the Madras High Court's order allowing the 'Karthigai Deepam' lighting atop Thiruparankundram hills. The state claims exclusive rights over temple rituals, defying the HC's directives. The SC acknowledged the plea but offered no immediate assurance for an early listing.

title: Cardi B’s wild twerk show at Stefon Diggs’ birthday leaves fans stunned
content: Cardi B's energetic twerk performance at Stefon Diggs' Miami birthday bash has set the internet ablaze. The rapper's celebratory dance, set to Metro Boomin's track, captured widespread attention, highlighting the couple's high-profile romance. This viral moment underscores the public's fascination with Cardi B's life, from her relationships to her public appearances, ensuring their continued presence in trending topics.

title: Driving patterns that reveal early signs of cognitive decline and memory loss
content: Your driving habits might be an early indicator of brain health, according to new research. Subtle changes like avoiding night drives or sticking to familiar routes could signal cognitive decline years before memory loss is apparent. This real-world data offers a powerful, proactive way to screen for potential issues, prompting timely medical attention and intervention.

title: Alia Bhatt’s Mumbai griha pravesh shines with her Manish Malhotra tissue silk saree
content: Alia Bhatt turns her Mumbai home’s griha pravesh into a royal runway in an alluring tissue silk saree by fashion maestro Manish Malhotra.

title: JDU politician stirs pot again, says many want Nitish’s son in politics
content: JDU's working president Sanjay Kumar Jha indicated that party members and supporters desire for Nishant Kumar, son of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, to enter politics. Jha stated the decision rests with the 49-year-old engineer. Nishant, who has recently increased his public presence and praised his father's governance, declined to comment on the matter.

title: Home loan interest rates set to fall to historic low of 7.1% after RBI move
content: Home loan rates are poised to fall to Covid-era lows following a 25 basis point repo rate cut by the RBI. This move is expected to lower EMIs for borrowers, though banks may need to adjust deposit rates. Non-banking finance companies anticipate immediate benefits from reduced funding costs, aiding last-mile financiers and small businesses.

title: Travis Kelce’s candid comments on Taylor Swift spark fresh future speculation
content: Travis Kelce recently spoke about his trip to Lake Como with Taylor Swift. He described the beautiful scenery and the warmth of the local people. Kelce expressed his joy and wonder at the experience, finding a new appreciation for life's pace. George Clooney also joined the conversation, sharing his own fondness for the Italian region.

title: India, Russia agree to boost efforts on joint climate action
content: India and Russia have pledged to boost joint efforts on climate action, aligning with global UN goals and the Paris Agreement. Both nations will collaborate on increasing climate finance and technology access for developing countries. They also agreed to intensify dialogue on carbon trading, low-carbon technologies, and sustainable finance, while continuing cooperation within G20, Brics, and SCO.

title: Maha civic polls result after Dec 20 voting: SC upholds HC order
content: The Supreme Court has cleared the way for the immediate declaration of Maharashtra civic election results, dismissing any further delays due to pending High Court cases. The apex court ruled that results for all municipal bodies will be announced after the final round of voting on December 20, irrespective of ongoing legal challenges.

title: Dying declaration can’t be rejected due to time lag: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that a dying declaration remains valid even if there's a time gap before the victim's death, and it doesn't need to be made under immediate threat. Such statements, even if not recorded by a magistrate or medically certified for mental fitness, are admissible. This decision allows prosecution of in-laws in a dowry death case.

title: US journalist injured in landmine blast in Chin state’s Tedin Township
content: In a harrowing turn of events, American journalist Collin Mayfield is currently receiving medical care at Ebenezer Hospital in Aizawl following a landmine explosion in Myanmar's Chin state. The incident occurred on November 18 as Mayfield reported on fierce clashes near Kennedy Peak.

title: India nears target but still bears 73% of South Asia’s malaria burden: WHO
content: India shoulders a significant malaria burden in Southeast Asia, despite regional progress. While cases have dropped dramatically, millions remain at risk, particularly in remote areas. Aggressive interventions have driven down incidence, but challenges like drug resistance and outbreaks in forest regions persist. India's progress marks a major shift towards elimination.

title: Pakistan: Why even a locked up Imran Khan may still be a threat for Asim Munir - explained
content: Imprisoned Imran Khan remains a potent threat to Pakistan's de facto ruler, army chief Asim Munir. Despite confinement, Khan's victimhood narrative and enduring popularity fuel sentiment against Munir's state control. The rivalry highlights the challenge of managing public perception versus institutional power.

title: Rashtrapati Bhavan dinner: Putin echoes ‘sabka saath, sabka vikas’ message - video
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin invoked India's 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas' slogan, stating it reflects the true character of India-Russia relations. He emphasized cooperation in the Eurasian space to build peace, trust, and security for all, highlighting the strategic and people-centric nature of their partnership.

title: After 10-yr chase, wildlife sleuths nab the ‘ghost’
content: Interpol-wanted wildlife trafficker Yangchen Lachungpa, a decade-long fugitive, was apprehended in a remote Sikkim village. Her arrest, following a complex operation, marks a significant breakthrough in combating international wildlife smuggling. Authorities believe her network linked Indian tiger reserves to Nepal, Tibet, and China, dealing in various endangered species parts.

title: "Not Could Be, It Will Be": Aviation Minister On Action Against IndiGo
content: IndiGo's operational meltdown is "on the verge of getting resolved", and action against the airline is a question of when, not if, Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu has said.

title: Railways Adds 116 Coaches To 37 Trains Amid IndiGo Cancellations
content: In view of the surge in passenger demand following widespread flight cancellations, the Indian Railways has deployed 116 additional coaches in 37premium trains operating over 114 enhanced trips across the country.

title: Over 3,000 Indian Nationals Deported From US In 2025: Centre
content: In 2025, as of November 21, as many as 3,155 Indian nationals have been deported from the US, the government informed Parliament on Friday.

title: IndiGo Flight Crisis Live Updates: Those Responsible For Meltdown Will Have To Pay For It, Says Minister
content: The cancellation and delay of all domestic flights of IndiGo departing from Delhi entered the fifth day on Saturday. The issue has affected tens of thousands of passengers who are worried about extended delays and soaring travel costs.

title: "Attack On US Firms": JD Vance, Marco Rubio On EU Slapping X With Huge Fine
content: The European Union hit Elon Musk's X with a 120-million-euro ($140-million) fine Friday for breaking its digital rules, sparking an angry reaction from Washington.

title: "One Of The Greatest Honours Of My Life": Trump On FIFA Peace Prize Award
content: US President Donald Trump said he was not attending the draw for the 2026 World Cup to receive a prize, but he got one anyway.

title: Maharashtra's Ruling Alliance Presents Report On 1 Year Of Governance
content: The Devendra Fadnavis-led Mahayuti government in Maharashtra completed one successful year of stable, transparent, and result-oriented governance.

title: Jhol Momo To Badam Halwa: Inside Lavish State Dinner Hosted For Putin At Rashtrapati Bhavan
content: The culinary delight for the Russian President showcased India's rich regional delicacies on a traditional 'thali'.

title: In UP, Cops Suspended For Dumping Unidentified Body In Another Area
content: Two police personnel including a sub-inspector and a home guard have been suspended for allegedly dumping an unidentified body in another area during the night, officials said on Friday.

title: 12 Labourers From UP Stranded In Kyrgyzstan, Families Allege They Are Being Tortured
content: The Pilibhit district administration has sent a detailed report to the Uttar Pradesh Home Department regarding the case of 12 labourers from the district, who are reportedly stranded and facing harassment in Kyrgyzstan, officials said on Friday.

title: Pro-Khalistan Terrorist Group, Sikh Businessman Sanctioned In UK
content: The UK government has announced sanctions against a British Sikh businessman and a group associated with him in the first use of the country's 'Domestic Counter-Terrorism Regime' to disrupt funding for the pro-Khalistan terrorist group Babbar Khalsa.

title: 27-Year-Old Delhi University Law Student Stabbed To Death: Cops
content: A 27-year-old Delhi University law student was allegedly stabbed to death following a quarrel with his relatives in south Delhi's Sangam Vihar on Friday morning, police said.

title: "Getting Back To Normalcy": Delhi Airport Issues Advisory Amid IndiGo Chaos
content: Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi issued a passenger advisory, assuring that Indigo flight operations are now "steadily resuming" after the airline fiasco that saw over 1,000 flights cancelled on Friday.

title: Punctuality Of Indian Railways Better Than Many European Nations: Minister
content: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Friday told the Rajya Sabha that the overall punctuality of Indian Railways has significantly increased to 80 per cent which was better than several European countries.

title: Jair Bolsonaro Backs Eldest Son For Next Year's Brazil Presidential Run
content: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has signaled he intends to support his eldest son, Senator Flavio Bolsonaro, as a presidential candidate in the 2026 election, his political party said on Friday, weighing on local financial markets.

title: US Court Clears Justice Department To Release Epstein Grand Jury Transcripts
content: A Florida federal judge on Friday cleared the Justice Department to release grand jury transcripts from its sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein, which could shed light on the deceased financier's ties to rich and powerful people.

title: Pak, Afghanistan Exchange Heavy Fire Along Border Amid Heightened Tensions
content: Pakistan and Afghanistan exchanged heavy fire along their border late on Friday, officials from both countries said, amid heightened tensions following failed peace talks earlier this week.

title: Frank Gehry, The Most Celebrated Architect Of His Time, Dies At 96
content: Frank Gehry, who designed some of most imaginative buildings ever constructed and achieved a level of worldwide acclaim seldom afforded any architect, has died. He was 96.

title: US Lawmakers Press Google, Apple To Remove Apps Tracking Immigration Agents
content: The House Committee on Homeland Security has asked Google and Apple to detail what steps they are taking to remove mobile applications that allow users to track federal immigration officers.

title: With Direct Connectivity To Airport, Navi Mumbai Gets New Train Station
content: Ahead of operations beginning at the Navi Mumbai International Airport on December 25, the airport will also get a railway station nearby, as the Targhar station on the Uran-Belapur line is also operationalised.

title: 150m Myanmar border fence cut in Manipur
content:
IMPHAL: Over 150 metres of fence in newly constructed section along Myanmar border in Manipur’s Chandel district was cut in the second instance of such a security breach in the state in four months. Officials said they had zeroed in on the suspects but declined to reveal their identities, citing ongoing investigations. The “sabotage” was detected during an inspection on Wednesday. Around 64 hollow circular poles and fencing panels, along with some other accessories, were ripped and yanked off, the officials said. The damage has raised serious questions about vigilance and effectiveness of forces patrolling the border. The previous such breach was detected in Aug this year. The Centre has undertaken extensive efforts to secure the Myanmar frontier, with Border Roads Organisation (BRO) carrying out fencing across vulnerable stretches. An FIR was filed over the latest breach. Security has been tightened in the area.

End of Article

title: Swamy Shraddananda’s mercy petition rejected
content:
Representative image

NEW DELHI: Supreme Court on Friday refused to entertain a plea filed by Swamy Shraddananda — who is undergoing imprisonment for rest of his natural life for killing his wife — seeking direction to govt to take an early decision on his mercy plea. A bench of Justices JK Maheshwari and Vijay Bishnoi asked the petitioner to approach the Karnataka govt for his grievances. Advocate Varun Thakur, appearing for the petitioner, then withdrew the plea to approach the state govt. Shraddananda, 84, alias Murali Manohar Mishra, whose wife was the grand-daughter of a former ‘dewan’ of the princely state of Mysore, had sought a review of the July 2008 verdict of a three-judge SC bench. The apex court had last year refused to entertain a petition filed by Shraddananda, seeking a review of the verdict, which had directed he should remain in prison for the rest of his life.

End of Article

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: USC secures its No. 1 spot

title: 'Basketball first': The ACC comes face-to-face with its issues, real and perceived
content: the ACC's system isn't much different than other conferences, coach says . it's a quirk of modern college football -- sprawling conferences with limited crossover between teams . if the stakes weren't so high, it might be a charming queirk of the conference .
